register.description: This register contains the DMA revision code

bitfield.description: Reserved, Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

register.description: The interrupt status register regroups all the status of the DMA4 channels that can generate an interrupt over line Lj.

bitfield.description: Channel 31 Interrupt on Lj: When an interrupt is seen on the line Lj the status of a interrupting channel i is read in the bit field i.

bitenum.description: Channel Interrupt Lj status bit unchanged
Channel Interrupt Lj status bit is reset

bitenum.description: Channel Interrupt Lj status bit unchanged

register.description: The interrupt enable register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on line Lj

bitfield.description: Channel Interrupt on Lj mask/unmask : to Mask/Unmask a channel i interrupt on Lj the user writes 0/1 on the bit field i.

bitenum.description: Channel Interrupt Lj generates an interrupt when it occurs

register.description: The interrupt enable register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on line Lj

register.description: The register provides status information about the module excluding the interrupt status information (see interrupt status register)

bitfield.description: Reserved for module-specific status information
Internal reset monitoring
Write 0's for future compatibility, Reads return 0
Read write power management, standby/wait control

bitenum.description: Force-standby: MStandby is asserted only when all the DMA channels are disabled

Smart-Standby: MStandby is asserted if at least one of the following two conditions is satisfied: 1. All the channels are disabled, OR 2. There is no non-synchronized channel enabled AND [if hardware synchronized channel is enabled, then no DMA request input is asserted and no requests are pending to be serviced].

bitfield.description: Reserved for clocks activities extension
Clocks activities during wake-up Bit 8: Interface clock 0x0: Interface clock can be switched-off Bit 9: Functional clock 0x0: Functional clock can be switched-off
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Enable sensitivity to MSuspend

bitenum.description: DMA4 freezes its internal logic upon MSuspend assertion

bitfield.description: Configuration port power management, Idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Force-idle. An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally
No-idle. An idle request is never acknowledged

Smart-idle. Idle acknowledge is given by DMA4 if all of the conditions are true: 1. All the channels are disabled. 2. If hardware synchronized channel is enabled, then no DMA request input is asserted and no requests are pending to be serviced. 3. All transactions are completed on all the DMA ports. 4.No interrupts are pending to be serviced.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility, Reads return 0
Reserved . .
Internal interface clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic interface clock gating strategy is applied, based on the interface activity.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Link List capability for type4 descriptor capability
Link List capability for type123 descriptor capability

bitenum.description: No LCH supports constant fill copy
any LCH supports constant fill copy
No LCH supports transparent BLT copy
any LCH suports transparent BLT copy

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

bitenum.description: Does not support separate src/dst index for 2D addressing
Supports separate src/dest index for 2D addressing
Does not support double index address mode on the destination port
Supports double index address mode on the destination port
Does not support single index address mode on the destination port
Supports single index address mode on the destination port
Does not supports post-increment address mode in the destination port
Supports post-increment address mode in the destination port
Does not supports constant address mode in the destination port
Supports constant address mode in the destination port
Does not support double index address mode on the source port
Supports double index address mode on the source port
Does not support single index address mode on the source port
Supports single index address mode in the source port
Does not supports post-increment address mode in the source port
Supports post-increment address mode in the source port
Does not supports constant address mode in the source port
Supports constant address mode in the source port

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

bitenum.description: Does not support synchronization transfer on block boundary
Supports synchronization transfer on block boundary
Does not support synchronization transfer on packet boundary
Supports synchronization transfer on packet boundary
Does not support Channel Chaninig capability
Does not support Channel interleave capability
Does not support synchronization transfer on Frame boundary
Supports synchronization transfer on Frame boundary
Does not support synchronization transfer on Element boundary
Supports synchronization transfer on Element boundary

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
End of Super Block detection capability.
Drain End detection capability.
Misaligned error detection capability.
Supervisor error detection capability.
Transaction error detection capability.
End of Packet detection capability.

bitenum.description: Does not support end of packet interrupt generation capabitity
Supports end of packet interrupt generation capability
Does not support synchronized transfer status bit generation
Supports synchronized transfer status bit generation

bitfield.description: End of block detection capability.

bitenum.description: Does not support end of block interrupt generation capability
Supports end of block interrupt generation capability

bitfield.description: Start of last frame detection capability.

bitenum.description: Does not support last frame interrupt generation capability
Supports last frame interrupt generation capability

bitfield.description: End of frame detection capability.

bitenum.description: Does not support end of frame interrupt generation capability
Supports end of frame interrupt generation capability

bitfield.description: Detection capability of the half of frame end.

bitenum.description: Does not support half of frame interrupt generation capability
Supports half of frame interrupt generation capability

bitfield.description: Request collision detection capability.

bitenum.description: Does not support event drop interrupt generation capability
Supports event drop interrupt generation capability

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

Gates the Channel ID bus monitoring on both Read and Write ports 0x0: Gates the Channel ID qualifiers on both Read and Write Ports 0x1: Does not gate the Channel ID qualifiers on both Read and Write Ports
Arbitration switching rate between prioritized and regular channel queues

Allow to have a separate Global FIFO budget for high and low priority channels. For Hi priority Channel: (Per_channel_Maximum FIFO depth + 1) x Number of active High priority Channel =&lt; High Budget FIFO For Low priority channel: (Per_channel_Maximum FIFO depth + 1) x Number of active Low priority Channel =&lt; Low Budget FIFO

bitenum.description: no fixed budget for neither higher nor lower priority channel
75% of FIFO for low priority and 25% for high priority channels
25% of FIFO for low priority and 75% for high priority channels
50% of FIFO for low priority and 50% for high priority channels

bitfield.description: Allow thread reservation for high priority channel on both read and write ports.

bitenum.description: No ThreadID is reserved on the Read Port for high priority channels. No ThreadID is reserved on the Write Port for high priority channels.
Read Port ThreadID 0 is reserved for high priority channels. Write Port ThreadID 0 is reserved for high priority channels.
Read port ThreadID 0 and ThreadID 1 are reserved for high priority channels. Write Port ThreadID 0 is reserved for high priority channels.
Read PortThreadID 0, ThreadID 1 and ThreadID 2 are reserved for high priority channels. Write Port ThreadID 0 is reserved for high priority channels.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

Maximum FIFO depth allocated to one logical channel. Maximum FIFO depth can not be 0x0. It should be at least 0x1 or greater. Note that If channel limit is less than destination burst size enough data will not be accumulated in the data FIFO and it will never be sent out on the WR port. The burst size should be less than the FIFO limit specified in this bit field.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: This bit allows to disable the default buffering functionality when transfer is source synchronized.

bitenum.description: buffering is enable across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks
buffering is disabled across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks

bitfield.description: Specifyes that element, packet, frame or block transfer (depending on CCR.bs and CCR.fs) is triggered by the source or the destination on the DMA request

bitenum.description: Tansfer is triggered by the destination. If synch on packet the packet element number is specified in the CDFI register
Tansfer is triggered by the source. If synchronized on packet the packet element number is specified in the CSFI register

bitfield.description: Enables the prefetch mode

bitenum.description: Prefetch mode is disabled. When Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1 transfers are buffred and pipelined between DMA requests

Prefetch mode is enabled. Prefetch mode is active only when destination is synchronised. It is SW user responsibility not to have at the same time Prefetch=1 when Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1. This mode is not supported

bitfield.description: Enables the supervisor mode
Channel Synchronization control upper (used in conjunction with the 5 bits of synchro channelDMA4_CCRi[4:0]) Used in conjunction, as two msb, with the five bits of the synchro channel bit field.
Block synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the fs to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer
Transparent copy enable
Constant fill enable
Selects the addressing mode on the Write Port of a channel.
Selects the addressing mode on the Read Port of a channel.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Indicates if the channel write context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the write port
Channel is currenly active on the write port

bitfield.description: Indicates if the channel read context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the read port
Channel is currently active on the read port

bitfield.description: Logical channel suspend enable bit

bitenum.description: The channel ignores the MSuspend even if EMUFree is set to 0.

If EMUFree is set to 0 and MSuspend comes in then all current OCP services (single transaction or burst transaction as specified in the corresponding CSDP register) have to be completed before stopping processing any more trasactions

bitfield.description: Logical channel enable. It is SW responsibility to clear the CSR register and the IRQSTATUS bit for the different interrupt lines before enabling the channel.
Channel priority on the read side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Read side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on read sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: Frame synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the BS to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer FS=0 and BS=0: An element is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=0 and BS=1: An entire block is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=0: An entire frame is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=1: A packet is transferred once a DMA request is made. All these different transfers can be interleaved on the port with other DMA requests.

Channel synchronization control This bit field used in conjuntion with the second_level_ synchro_control_upper (as two msb) 0000000 : Is reserved for non synchronized LCH transfer xxxxxxx (from 1 to 127)There are 127 possible DMA request to assign to any LCH. The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

Channel synchronization control This bit field used in conjuntion with the second_level_ synchro_control_upper (as two msb) 0000000 : Is reserved for non synchronized LCH transfer xxxxxxx (from 1 to 127)There are 127 possible DMA request to assign to any LCH. The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: This bit allows to disable the default buffering functionality when transfer is source synchronized.

bitenum.description: buffering is enable across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks

bitfield.description: Specifyes that element, packet, frame or block transfer (depending on CCR.bs and CCR.fs) is triggered by the source or the destination on the DMA request

bitenum.description: Tansfer is triggered by the destination. If synch on packet the packet element number is specified in the CDFI register
Tansfer is triggered by the source. If synchronized on packet the packet element number is specified in the CSFI register

bitfield.description: Enables the prefetch mode

bitenum.description: Prefetch mode is disabled. When Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1 transfers are buffred and pipelined between DMA requests

Prefetch mode is enabled. Prefetch mode is active only when destination is synchronised. It is SW user responsibility not to have at the same time Prefetch=1 when Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1. This mode is not supported

bitfield.description: Enables the supervisor mode

Constant fill enable

Selects the addressing mode on the Read Port of a channel.

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the read port
Channel is currently active on the read port

bitfield.description: Logical channel suspend enable bit

bitenum.description: The channel ignores the MSuspend even if EMUFree is set to 0.

If EMUFree is set to 0 and MSuspend comes in then all current OCP services (single transaction or burst transaction as specified in the corresponding CSDP register) have to be completed before stopping processing any more trasactions

Tansfer is triggered by the source. If synchronized on packet the packet element number is specified in the CSFI register

bitfield.description: Enables the prefetch mode

bitenum.description: Prefetch mode is disabled. When Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1 transfers are buffred and pipelined between DMA requests

Prefetch mode is enabled. Prefetch mode is active only when destination is synchronised. It is SW user responsibility not to have at the same time Prefetch=1 when Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1. This mode is not supported

bitfield.description: Enables the supervisor mode
Channel Synchronization control upper (used in conjunction with the 5 bits of synchro channelDMA4_CCRi[4:0]) Used in conjunction, as two msb, with the five bits of the synchro channel bit field.
Block synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the fs to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer
Transparent copy enable
Constant fill enable
Selects the addressing mode on the Write Port of a channel.
Selects the addressing mode on the Read Port of a channel.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Indicates if the channel write context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the write port
Channel is currenly active on the write port

bitfield.description: Indicates if the channel read context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the read port
Channel is currently active on the read port

bitfield.description: Logical channel suspend enable bit

bitenum.description: The channel ignores the MSuspend even if EMUFree is set to 0.

If EMUFree is set to 0 and MSuspend comes in then all current OCP services (single transaction or burst transaction as specified in the corresponding CSDP register) have to be completed before stopping processing any more trasactions

bitfield.description: Logical channel enable. It is SW responsibility to clear the CSR register and the IRQSTATUS bit for the different interrupt lines before enabling the channel.
Channel priority on the read side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Read side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on read sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: Frame synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the BS to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer FS=0 and BS=0: An element is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=0 and BS=1: An entire block is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=0: An entire frame is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=1: A packet is transferred once a DMA request is made. All these different transfers can be interleaved on the port with other DMA requests.

Channel synchronization control This bit field used in conjuntion with the second_level_ synchro_control_upper (as two msb) 0000000 : Is reserved for non synchronized LCH transfer xxxxxxx (from 1 to 127)There are 127 possible DMA request to assign to any LCH. The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: This bit allows to disable the default buffering functionality when transfer is source synchronized.

bitenum.description: buffering is enable across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks
buffering is disabled across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the read port
Channel is currently active on the read port

bitfield.description: Logical channel suspend enable bit

bitenum.description: The channel ignores the MSuspend even if EMUFree is set to 0.

If EMUFree is set to 0 and MSuspend comes in then all current OCP services (single transaction or burst transaction as specified in the corresponding CSDP register) have to be completed before stopping processing any more trasactions

bitfield.description: Logical channel enable. It is SW responsibility to clear the CSR register and the IRQSTATUS bit for the different interrupt lines before enabling the channel.
Channel priority on the read side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Read side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on read sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: Frame synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the BS to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer FS=0 and BS=0: An element is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=0 and BS=1: An entire block is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=0: An entire frame is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=1: A packet is transferred once a DMA request is made. All these different transfers can be interleaved on the port with other DMA requests.

Channel synchronization control This bit field used in conjuntion with the second_level_ synchro_control_upper (as two msb) 0000000 : Is reserved for non synchronized LCH transfer xxxxxxx (from 1 to 127)There are 127 possible DMA request to assign to any LCH. The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: This bit allows to disable the default buffering functionality when transfer is source synchronized.

buffering is disabled across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks

bitfield.description: Specifyes that element, packet, frame or block transfer (depending on CCR.bs and CCR.fs) is triggered by the source or the destination on the DMA request

bitenum.description: Tansfer is triggered by the destination. If synch on packet the packet element number is specified in the CDFI register
Tansfer is triggered by the source. If synchronized on packet the packet element number is specified in the CSFI register

bitfield.description: Enables the prefetch mode

bitenum.description: Prefetch mode is disabled. When Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1 transfers are buffred and pipelined between DMA requests

Prefetch mode is enabled. Prefetch mode is active only when destination is synchronised. It is SW user responsibility not to have at the same time Prefetch=1 when Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1. This mode is not supported

bitfield.description: Enables the supervisor mode

Constant fill enable

The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Channel priority on the Write side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Write side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on Write sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: This bit allows to disable the default buffering functionality when transfer is source synchronized.

bitenum.description: buffering is enable across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks
buffering is disabled across element/packet when source is synchronized to element, packet, frame or bolcks

bitfield.description: Specifyes that element, packet, frame or block transfer (depending on CCR.bs and CCR.fs) is triggered by the source or the destination on the DMA request

bitenum.description: Tansfer is triggered by the destination. If synch on packet the packet element number is specified in the CDFI register
Tansfer is triggered by the source. If synchronized on packet the packet element number is specified in the CSFI register

bitfield.description: Enables the prefetch mode

bitenum.description: Prefetch mode is disabled. When Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1 transfers are buffred and pipelined between DMA requests

Prefetch mode is enabled. Prefetch mode is active only when destination is synchronised. It is SW user responsibility not to have at the same time Prefetch=1 when Sel_Src_Dst_Sync=1. This mode is not supported

bitfield.description: Enables the supervisor mode
Channel Synchronization control upper (used in conjunction with the 5 bits of synchro channelDMA4_CCRi[4:0]) Used in conjunction, as two msb, with the five bits of the synchro channel bit field.
Block synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the fs to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer
Transparent copy enable
Constant fill enable
Selects the addressing mode on the Write Port of a channel.
Selects the addressing mode on the Read Port of a channel.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Indicates if the channel write context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the write port
Channel is currenly active on the write port

bitfield.description: Indicates if the channel read context is active or not

bitenum.description: Channel is not active on the read port
Channel is currently active on the read port

bitfield.description: Logical channel suspend enable bit

bitenum.description: The channel ignores the MSuspend even if EMUFree is set to 0.

If EMUFree is set to 0 and MSuspend comes in then all current OCP services (single transaction or burst transaction as specified in the corresponding CSDP register) have to be completed before stopping processing any more trasactions

bitfield.description: Logical channel enable. It is SW responsibility to clear the CSR register and the IRQSTATUS bit for the different interrupt lines before enabling the channel.
Channel priority on the read side

bitenum.description: Channel has low priority on the Read side during the arbitration process
Channel has high priority on read sided during the arbitration process

bitfield.description: Frame synchronization This bit used in conjuntion with the BS to see how the DMA request is serviced in a synchronized transfer FS=0 and BS=0: An element is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=0 and BS=1: An entire block is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=0: An entire frame is transferred once a DMA request is made. FS=1 and BS=1: A packet is transferred once a DMA request is made. All these different transfers can be interleaved on the port with other DMA requests.

Channel synchronization control This bit field used in conjuntion with the second_level_ synchro_control_upper (as two msb) 0000000 : Is reserved for non synchronized LCH transfer xxxxxxx (from 1 to 127)There are 127 possible DMA request to assign to any LCH. The channel synchronization control registers are 1-based. For example, to enable the S_DMA_1 request, DMA4_CCR[4:0] SYNCHRO_CONTROL must be set to 0x2 (DMA request number + 1).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Enables or disable the channel linking.

bitenum.description: Channel linking mode is disabled When set on the fly to 0 the current channel will complete the transfer and stops the chain linking
Channel linking mode is enabled. The logical channel defined in the NextLCH_ID is enabled at the end of the current transfer

register.description: Channel Source Frame Index (Signed) or 16-bit Packet size

bitfield.description: Channel source frame index value if source address is in double index mode. Or if fs=bs=1 and DMA_CCR[SEL_SRC_DST_SYNC]=1; the bit field [15:0] gives the number of element in packet. The field [31:16] is unused for the packet size.

Color key or solid color pattern: The pattern is replicated according to the data type. If the data-type is 8-bit the pattern is replicated 4 times to fill the register in order to enhance processing when data is packed at the graphic module input. The same resoning for 16-bit data-type.

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the link list mechanism

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility, Reads return 0
Sets the fast-start mode for linked list descriptor types 1, 2 and 3
Enable linked-list transfer mode

bitenum.description: Linked-list channel mode for type 1, 2, or 3 descriptor is used.

bitfield.description: Suspend the linked-list transfer at completion of the current block transfer.

bitenum.description: Linked list is suspended at the boundary of next descriptor loading.

bitfield.description: Next Descriptor Type
Source address valid

bitenum.description: The source address is not present in the next descriptor and continuous incrementing is enabled.
The source address must be reloaded in the next descriptor transfer.
The source start address is not present in the next descriptor. But will reload the one from configuration memory which belongs to the previous descriptor.

bitfield.description: Destination address valid

bitenum.description: The destination address is not present in the next descriptor and continuous incrementing is enabled.
The destination address must be reloaded in the next descriptor transfer.
The destination start address is not present in the next descriptor. But will reload the one from configuration memory which belongs to the previous descriptor.

bitenum.description: The source address is not present in the next descriptor and continuous incrementing is enabled.
The source address must be reloaded in the next descriptor transfer.
The source start address is not present in the next descriptor. But will reload the one from configuration memory which belongs to the previous descriptor.

bitfield.description: Destination address valid

bitenum.description: The destination address is not present in the next descriptor and continuous incrementing is enabled.
The destination address must be reloaded in the next descriptor transfer.
The destination start address is not present in the next descriptor. But will reload the one from configuration memory which belongs to the previous descriptor.

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the link list mechanism

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility, Reads return 0
Sets the fast-start mode for linked list descriptor types 1, 2 and 3
Enable linked-list transfer mode

bitenum.description: Linked-list channel mode for type 1, 2, or 3 descriptor is used.

bitfield.description: Suspend the linked-list transfer at completion of the current block transfer.

bitenum.description: Linked list is suspended at the boundary of next descriptor loading.

bitenum.description: The destination address is not present in the next descriptor and continuous incrementing is enabled.
The destination address must be reloaded in the next descriptor transfer.
The destination start address is not present in the next descriptor. But will reload the one from configuration memory which belongs to the previous descriptor.
